name: Casa di Sara B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: This was a good bargain, only a block off Piazza Navona. No frills but clean. Breakfast was a buffet at a restaurant around the corner, not great.
reviews.title: Plain but clean with an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went on 22nd Oct for 3 nights, unfortunately the rain had caused some damage to Casa Di Sara but fortunately Antonio the owner has just opened another B&B called Piazza Navona B&B 50 meters up the street. Big rooms, air con, fridge if you wanted to keep food/drink chilled ! We were right beside the Piazza Navona, Antonio (the owner) told us all the good places to eat and we were not dissapointed, Ponte & Parione restorante makes the thinnest pizza and as for their fillet of beef with balsamatic sauce perfection on a plate. this was our second time in Rome this year and when we go back we will definetly not be staying in a 4 star hotel like the first time, instead we will go back to casa di sara or piazza navona b&b. Friendly,Helpful Staff. Our room was Clean,bedding and towels changed daily, Breakfast was just up the street,continental of course.
reviews.title: What a Gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK.
reviews.title: Wonderful Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Susan and I stayed for five days at this B&B and thought it was delightful. It is a new residence set in the heart of old Roma. It is in I believe a 15-16th century tower that has quite a bit of character. You will have a slice of Roman life right outside your window that we felt was delightful. The entry into the tower is by steps only, there is no elevator but for ourselves this simply added to the charm. The room was spacious, clean and the service was simple yet adequate. I have stayed at the high end places. If you are looking for 4-5 star service continue on. But if you are looking for a good deal, great location and lots of character up to inspiring this will be a wonderful experience.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Sincerely,
reviews.title: A little piece of beautiful, old-world charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent location for you to stay in Rome - it's about 4 blocs from the Pantheon and 1 block from Piazza Navona Square. Atnonini (the owner) is really really friendly and helpful. We were a little disappointed because we could not see the tower bc it was under construction and completely covered. Other than that, room was very clean and comfortable!!! would stay there again if I were to go to Rome! Thanks Antoniny!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Also it was very close (by taxi about 10 minutes and costs only 10-12euros if driver is honest) to Termini Station. Plus lots and losts of restaurants around
reviews.title: Great service from Antonio, but that is it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We choose the appartment of Casa di Sara. When we arrived Antonio was their for check-in.
reviews.title: Good B&B in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: He told us that we could stay for 3 nights (confirmation was 5 nights). After talking to his son we could stay for 5 nights in the appartment. It is on the 4th floor. Yes, climbing 4 stairs with our kids and 4 suitcases. It was a disappointment. No lounge at all! 1 bedroom with a king and 1 with bunkbeds!! No signs of that when we made reservations on booking.com
reviews.title: Great place but no elevator

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Thank God: the bathroom was clean. But with 4, the last one had a cold shower.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B in the heart of Rome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been to Rome many times and chose this b&b due to its fantastic location.
reviews.title: Nothing left wanting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Our room was very good, quite spacious and we were lucky enough to have two little balconies. The area is very busy at night however with double windows and shutters little street noise can be heard. The included breakfast was also very nice, at a little bar just next door. Great experience overall.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location. Right next to Piazza Navona and ideally located to walk to the main attractions or to catch public transport. When in Rome, yu ave to ge out and about, so this place was awesome. The room we had was huge, clean, cool and comfortable. The beds were comfortable, the shower fanastic, and the fridge kept the beers cold! We opted out of the breakfast, and went local. There are numerous caves to choose from. The owner is very helpful and a pleasure to deal with. Overall, great value for money in a city where accommodation can be very expensive.
reviews.title: It's all about the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a short stay right in the heart of Rome at a reasonable price this is ideal.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every main tourist location is walking distance away.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed our recent stay at Casa di Sara. Great for the independent traveller who wants a B&B with a little privacy. Steps from Piazzas Navona and Farnesse, Pantheon and Campo di Fiori. Lots of food and drink nearby. Staff was friendly and helpful when needed. Interesting to stay in an historic tower, but there are a lot of steps. They are expanding and will soon be renting out new apartments.
reviews.title: Best Location in Rome by Far!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: Nice clean B&B in the heart of Roma. Big rooms. No recption but good service on arrival by phone. Friendly host WHO Will show Nice restaurants in the area. You feel like you belong. Breakfest is in closeby cafe and is ok. Italian caputiono/expresso is served at no extra cost. Streets are lively around the clock and noisy but extra Windows make rooms completely quiert
reviews.title: High value for money in the Best spot in Roma for turists

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B&B is located in an old tower steps from Piazza Navona. The location is perfect, being less than a 10 minute walk to the Pantheon, 10-15 minutes to the Vatican, and 15-20 minutes to the Colosseum. You can walk everywhere from this hotel and not have to use public transportation. The owner, Antonio, is extremely friendly and helpful. He was waiting outside when we arrived and after he checked us in he gave us several tips on how to get around Rome and what to see. There is also a phone there which Antonio told us to use to contact him if we needed to reach him. You do have to climb a few flights of stairs to get to your room and there is no elevator, however, this was not an issue for us. Although the B&B is located steps from Piazza Navona, the room we stayed in was very quiet thanks to the double windows Antonio had installed. The room was large and clean, the bed was comfortable, and there was a tv and a refrigerator. A voucher was included for breakfast (a croissant, juice, and coffee) at a bar across from the tower. Antonio was also helpful in arranging a cab ride for us to the airport to catch our flight home. We were very happy with our stay at Casa di Sara and we would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: THE Place to Stay in Rome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights in triple room and loved everything about it: from fantastic location, to spatious, sound-proof room overlooking lively restaurants, daily changed towels and breakfast in 3 different cafeterias that we were able to choose from.
reviews.title: Our home in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Owner Antinio made us feel "at home" in every sense: he stored our 3 big suitcases while we were touring Italy, allowed us to use his computer, recommended nice restaurants, reliable taxi to the airport and even bought the alarm clock as we needed one.
reviews.title: A Real Gem-well worth the climb !

aka: Casa Di Sara Bed And Breakfast
description: Housed right in the ancient Tor Millina, a medieval tower built in XIII century just a few meters away piazza Navona, one of the most breathtaking views the eternal city can offer, you will enjoy the opportunity to feel at home in the most exclusive and fascinating area of the city where history, magic, religion, luxury and glamor meet all together to give you an unforgettable time in Rome.
